etymology.description: Pictogram; later jiajie (phonetic loan) for “the people”.
etymology.interpretation: Originally a pictorial graph whose precise image is uncertain, it was later borrowed (jiajie) to write the word ‘people’. Claims that it depicts an eye pierced by a tool are likely folk etymology and are not supported by phonetic evidence linking it to 盲.

examples.chinese: 中国人民团结一致(中國人民團結一致)。
政府应倾听民意(政府應傾聽民意)。
examples.english: The government should listen to public opinion.

examples.chinese: 战乱时期，许多平民流离失所(戰亂時期，許多平民流離失所)。
examples.pinyin: Zhànluàn shíqī, xǔduō píngmín liúlí shīsuǒ.
examples.english: During wartime, many civilians are displaced.
